subject: Data
title: The Data Explosion Timeline
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Data Explosion Timeline.

hook.text: In 2000, the entire internet held about 2 exabytes. Today, that much is created every single day.

buildup.text: The explosion accelerated with smartphones, social media, IoT sensors, and streaming video.

discovery.text: 90% of the world's data was created in the last two years. The rest spans all of human history.

twist.text: Most of this data has never been analyzed. It's generated, stored briefly, then forgotten.

climax.text: We now generate more data in a day than existed in the entire world just 20 years ago.

punchline.text: Data is growing faster than our ability to use it.

quiz.question: Approximately what percentage of the world's data was created in the last two years?
